\begin{par}
\begin{flushleft}
Find the \textbf{derivative }of $\frac{d}{\mathrm{dx}}\left(x^2 +\mathrm{sin}\left(2x^4 \right)+1\right)$using the chain rule
\end{flushleft}
\end{par}

\begin{matlabcode}
syms x
diff(x^2+sin(2*x^4)+1,x)
\end{matlabcode}
\begin{matlabsymbolicoutput}
ans = 
    $\displaystyle 2\,x+8\,x^3 \,\cos \left(2\,x^4 \right)$
\end{matlabsymbolicoutput}


\begin{par}
\begin{flushleft}
\textbf{Integrate} and\textbf{ plot} $\int {\left(\frac{t+1}{t}\right)}^2 \mathrm{dt}$
\end{flushleft}
\end{par}

\begin{matlabcode}
syms t
int(((t+1)/t)^2,t)
\end{matlabcode}
\begin{matlabsymbolicoutput}
ans = 
    $\displaystyle t+2\,\log \left(t\right)-\frac{1}{t}$
\end{matlabsymbolicoutput}
\begin{matlabcode}
fplot(ans)
\end{matlabcode}
\begin{center}
\includegraphics[width=\maxwidth{56.196688409433015em}]{figure_0}
\end{center}


\begin{par}
\begin{flushleft}
Compute the\textbf{ Fourier Transform} $F\left(w\right)=c\int_{-\infty }^{\infty } f\left(x\right)e^{\mathrm{iswx}} \mathrm{dx}$
\end{flushleft}
\end{par}

\begin{par}
\begin{flushleft}
with respect to x at the evalution point w, with c=1 and s=-1.
\end{flushleft}
\end{par}

\begin{matlabcode}
fourier(exp(-x^2))
\end{matlabcode}


\begin{par}
\begin{flushleft}
Compute the\textbf{ Taylor Series} expansion of sin(x) at a=0
\end{flushleft}
\end{par}

\begin{matlabcode}
taylor(sin(x),'Order',8)
\end{matlabcode}
